To the chief Musician<S>5329</S> upon Shoshannim<S>7799</S>, for the sons<S>1121</S> of Korah<S>7141</S>, Maschil<S>4905</S>, A Song<S>7892</S> of loves<S>3039</S>. My heart<S>3820</S> is inditing<S>7370</S> a good<S>2896</S> matter<S>1697</S>: I speak<S>559</S> of the things which I have made<S>4639</S> touching the king<S>4428</S>: my tongue<S>3956</S> is the pen<S>5842</S> of a ready<S>4106</S> writer<S>5608</S>. <sup>Maschil: or, of instruction</sup> <sup>is inditing: Heb. boileth, or, bubbleth up</sup>
Thou art fairer<S>3302</S> than the children<S>1121</S> of men<S>120</S>: grace<S>2580</S> is poured<S>3332</S> into thy lips<S>8193</S>: therefore God<S>430</S> hath blessed<S>1288</S> thee for ever<S>5769</S>.
Gird<S>2296</S> thy sword<S>2719</S> upon thy thigh<S>3409</S>, O most mighty<S>1368</S>, with thy glory<S>1935</S> and thy majesty<S>1926</S>.
And in thy majesty<S>1926</S> ride<S>7392</S> prosperously<S>6743</S> because<S>1697</S> of truth<S>571</S> and meekness<S>6037</S> and righteousness<S>6664</S>; and thy right hand<S>3225</S> shall teach<S>3384</S> thee terrible things<S>3372</S>. <sup>ride: Heb. prosper thou, ride thou</sup>
Thine arrows<S>2671</S> are sharp<S>8150</S> in the heart<S>3820</S> of the king's<S>4428</S> enemies<S>341</S>; whereby the people<S>5971</S> fall<S>5307</S> under thee.
Thy throne<S>3678</S>, O God<S>430</S>, is for ever<S>5769</S> and ever<S>5703</S>: the sceptre<S>7626</S> of thy kingdom<S>4438</S> is a right<S>4334</S> sceptre<S>7626</S>.
Thou lovest<S>157</S> righteousness<S>6664</S>, and hatest<S>8130</S> wickedness<S>7562</S>: therefore God<S>430</S>, thy God<S>430</S>, hath anointed<S>4886</S> thee with the oil<S>8081</S> of gladness<S>8342</S> above thy fellows<S>2270</S>.
All thy garments<S>899</S> smell of myrrh<S>4753</S>, and aloes<S>174</S>, and cassia<S>7102</S>, out of the ivory<S>8127</S> palaces<S>1964</S>, whereby<S>4482</S> they have made thee glad<S>8055</S>.
Kings'<S>4428</S> daughters<S>1323</S> were among thy honourable women<S>3368</S>: upon thy right hand<S>3225</S> did stand<S>5324</S> the queen<S>7694</S> in gold<S>3800</S> of Ophir<S>211</S>.
Hearken<S>8085</S>, O daughter<S>1323</S>, and consider<S>7200</S>, and incline<S>5186</S> thine ear<S>241</S>; forget<S>7911</S> also thine own people<S>5971</S>, and thy father's<S>1</S> house<S>1004</S>;
So shall the king<S>4428</S> greatly desire<S>183</S> thy beauty<S>3308</S>: for he is thy Lord<S>113</S>; and worship<S>7812</S> thou him.
And the daughter<S>1323</S> of Tyre<S>6865</S> shall be there with a gift<S>4503</S>; even the rich<S>6223</S> among the people<S>5971</S> shall intreat<S>2470</S> thy favour<S>6440</S>. <sup>favour: Heb. face</sup>
The king's<S>4428</S> daughter<S>1323</S> is all glorious<S>3520</S> within<S>6441</S>: her clothing<S>3830</S> is of wrought<S>4865</S> gold<S>2091</S>.
She shall be brought<S>2986</S> unto the king<S>4428</S> in raiment of needlework<S>7553</S>: the virgins<S>1330</S> her companions<S>7464</S> that follow<S>310</S> her shall be brought<S>935</S> unto thee.
With gladness<S>8057</S> and rejoicing<S>1524</S> shall they be brought<S>2986</S>: they shall enter<S>935</S> into the king's<S>4428</S> palace<S>1964</S>.
Instead of thy fathers<S>1</S> shall be thy children<S>1121</S>, whom thou mayest make<S>7896</S> princes<S>8269</S> in all the earth<S>776</S>.
I will make thy name<S>8034</S> to be remembered<S>2142</S> in all<S>1755</S> generations<S>1755</S>: therefore shall the people<S>5971</S> praise<S>3034</S> thee for ever<S>5769</S> and ever<S>5703</S>.
